item.title: Back to Basics: Tech Reflection Chronicles
item.description: The cost-cutting imperative has triggered a reevaluation of all technologies, including databases. This series critiques hot DB technologies and poses fundamental questions about their trade-offs: Are cloud databases, distributed databases, microservices, and containerization real needs or false hype? item.description:

Even Amazon’s SOA paradigm team admits microservices and Serverless have problems. Prime Video team switched to monolith, saving 90% operational costs. Read more

item.title: Database Cluster Management Concepts and Entity Naming Conventions
item.description: Concepts and their naming are very important. Naming style reflects an engineer’s understanding of system architecture. Poorly defined concepts lead to communication confusion, while carelessly set names create unexpected additional burden. Therefore, they need careful design. Read more
